intro: Gonolobus fraternus, commonly known as the common goldenhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often dispersed by wind or animals. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
